name: Automatic Virtual Hard Drive File
summary: An AVHDX file is a disk image checkpoint used by Windows Server and its Microsoft Hyper-V technology, which bootstraps virtual machines (VM) using disk images. It contains the state, data, and hardware configuration of a VM at the time of the file creation. AVHDX files are created to save a specific state of a .VHDX virtual hard drive.
